title: SQL ServerTAN()Function

metadata.description: Learn about SQL ServerTAN()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return the tangent of a number:
SELECT TAN(1.75);

Definition and Usage
The TAN() function returns the tangent of a number.
Syntax
TAN(
number
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
number
Required. A numeric value
Technical Details
Works in:
SQL Server (starting with 2008), Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Data 
  Warehouse, Parallel Data Warehouse
More Examples
Example
Return the tangent of a number:
SELECT TAN(-3);

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers SQL ServerTAN()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SQL ServerTAN()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SQL ServerTAN()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
